data.title: Apple is suing Corellium
data.text: Apple is suing virtualization software company Corellium, according to documents filed today in Florida. Corellium allows customers to create and interact with virtual iOS devices — a software iPhone, for example, running actual iOS firmware, all within the browser.

data.title: Apple says it supports 2.4 million U.S. jobs
data.text: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it was either directly or indirectly responsible for 2.4 million U.S. jobs, up 20% from the 2 million the technology company estimated in 2017.

data.title: Gene Munster: We don't expect tariffs on Apple products
data.text: Loup Ventures Managing Partner Gene Munster talks Apple, China and tariff risks.

data.title: Thursday Apple Rumors: Possible iPhone 11 Details Leak
data.text:
Thursday's Apple Rumors include the release of a new beta for iOS 13 and iPadOS 13, the company scouting space in Manhattan and more.

data.title: Apple, Samsung continue growth as North American wearables market hits $2B
data.text: New numbers out of Canalys show strong continued growth for the North America wearables market for Q2. The market hit $2 billion value for the quarter, according to the firm, marking a 38% year over year growth.

data.title: 5 Tech Stocks That Are In Trouble Right Now
data.text: Tech stocks that were once darlings on Wall Street have become some of the hottest stocks to sell now as investors grow increasingly worried.

data.title: Apple Stock Is Looking Ripe for the Picking At $200
data.text: Apple stock has fallen nearly 10% after a solid earnings report and higher guidance. Time to add AAPL on any weakness.

data.title: The Apple Card has no numbers on it — here's how to find them to buy stuff online
data.text: Here's how to find your Apple Card number on your iPhone if you need to make a purchase that requires you to enter in a card number, expiration date and security code.
